content:
/>
VIII.iii.9.A.1.c
.
Military Occupational Hazards Exposure
Veterans may claim exposure to specific toxins based on the occupational duties they performed during their military service.  VA may not recognize specific disabilities as presumptively due to the claimed occupational exposure; therefore, each exposure event should be considered based on the places, types, and circumstances of the Veteran’s service, consistent with
38 CFR 3.303(a)
.
References
:  For more information on
military occupational hazards, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iii, 9.B
, and
presumptive SC, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, 2.B
.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iii, Chapter 9, Section A - General Information on Exposure to Specific Environmental or Military Occupational Hazards
citation: Part VIII, Subpart iii, Chapter 9, Section A
